title: Jamie Carragher criticises Jurgen Klopp's tactics and jokes that Liverpool players were out "drinking" in La Manga
text:
Jamie Carragher criticises Jurgen Klopp's tactics and jokes that Liverpool players were out "drinking" in La Manga The Reds legend believes the German has failed to rectify Liverpool's defensive problems of last season Share Jamie Carragher showed support for Lucas Leiva despite his poor display (Photo: Sky Sports) Share   Thank you for subscribing!   
Jamie Carragher criticised Jurgen Klopp's tactics in Liverpool's 3-1 defeat to Leicester City, accusing the German of failing to rectify last year's problems. 
But he also found the time to crack a joke at his former side's performance, suggesting the players must have been having too much fun on their recent trip to La Manga. 
Klopp's men were soundly beaten as Jamie Vardy scored in both halves of Monday night's clash at the King Power Stadium, while Danny Drinkwater notched with a long-range strike. 
Philippe Coutinho grabbed a late consolation for his side, but Carragher was critical of the fact the Reds performed in the same way they did in defeats to other lower-league teams this season. The Reds legend questioned Jurgen Klopp's tactics (Photo: Plumb Images) Liverpool were beaten 3-1 at the King Power Stadium (Photo: Getty Images Europe) 
"Liverpool were shocking tonight, I was at the games at Hull and Burnley and they were the exact same games," said the ex-Reds defender. 
"They're on course to concede 50 goals again this season and Klopp hasn't rectified that." 
Discussing individual players, Carragher added: "Lucas Leiva I'm sure will be getting plenty of stick. I felt so sorry for him as he shouldn't be playing there. 
"It would have been like playing me at right wing. There's no way he can catch Jamie Vardy in a sprint if the team are pushed up to the halfway line." Klopp took his players to La Manga for a warm weather training camp (Photo: Liverpool FC) Carragher joked that the Reds players were having too much fun while in Spain (Photo: Liverpool FC) 
Speaking on Sky Sports, Gary Neville called Liverpool's performance "woeful" at the break, but did find the time to crack a joke at their display alongside his co-host. 
Talking to Carragher, Neville asked: "Liverpool have been off for two weeks, what were they doing in La Manga?" The Reds legend quickly replied, while laughing, "Drinking?" 
Liverpool, who had a gap in their schedule due to no cup commitments, were in fact in Spain as part of a warm weather training camp and returned on Wednesday. poll loading Should Liverpool sack Jurgen Klopp? 0+ VOTES SO FAR
